data.text: @K_Eisenstein @ShaunLintern @uclh You are very welcome, glad we could give you a more sensible appointment, and sorry about the error. Take care!
@VRDonnelly @ShaunLintern @uclh @VRDonnelly just had a phone call from the admin team, who are sorting. If that's down to you then please accept a huge thank you from me ❤

@GillAtkinson11 @K_Eisenstein @uclh I'm also a patient there. My 'annual' reviews are stretching to 14 months and my last two have been on the phone. Given they were in March 2020 and spring the following year, that's OK. I'm stable. F2F in May (hopefully!)

@K_Eisenstein @uclh I totally relate to this. Since 2018 I've had 12 neurology appointments cancelled and re-scheduled - one appointment was for 14 months later. I've yet to meet my consultant!! Atkinson Morley, St George's Hospital, Tooting Broadway.

@K_Eisenstein @Harvard2H @uclh Praying that you get your appointment sooner! As much as our private health care system stinks regarding costs (granted you pay your share in taxes for nothing from how this looks) I'll keep our system as at least I can see a specialist in 6 months or most often much less time.
@K_Eisenstein @AnnaKharko @uclh and it’s only a phone call anyway!

@VRDonnelly @K_Eisenstein @ShaunLintern @uclh The power of Twitter!
Do *all* Trusts have someone watching Twitter - & able to take appropriate action?

@jacoblant @HealthwatchE I have no doubt about it. And it varies massively even between different parts of same dept in same hosp. Don't have same issues with my other neurologist (yes my brain is so broken that I have two - one for each condition). So the issue is about joined up care, or lack of.
@K_Eisenstein Oh Kate. Really sorry to hear that. You may feel like a lost statistic in the NHS but your story isn’t lost. I’ve heard it and from what we hear @HealthwatchE you’re sadly not alone.

@K_Eisenstein @uclh And we never know who we will see (not 'be seen by', as they often say): they put consultant's name & then 'or a member of the/their team' - which could mean a brand new trainee & us used to train them = no thanks, been v injured by trainees+ several times - & consultants.
